headline: Air Fryer Hanukkah Latkes
description: This super-simple air fryer latkes —  made with grated potatoes, onion, matzo meal, and eggs — are just as crispy and delicious as traditional fried latkes.
recipeIngredient: Sour cream and applesauce, for serving

recipeInstructions.name: Step 1
recipeInstructions.text: Peel 1 1/2 pounds russet potatoes. Grate the potatoes and 1/2 yellow onion on the large holes of a box grater. Place together on a clean kitchen towel, pull up the sides of the towel to form a bundle, and squeeze out excess moisture.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 2
recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the potato mixture to a large bowl. Add 2 large eggs, 1/4 cup matzo meal, 2 teaspoons kosher salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, and stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 3
recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an Instant Vortex Plus 7-in-1 Air Fryer Oven to 375ºF and set to 16 minutes. Coat the air fryer racks with cooking spray. Drop the latke mixture in 2-tablespoon dollops into the air fryer, flattening the tops to make a patty. Spray the tops of the latkes with cooking spray. Air fry, rotating the trays halfway through, for 8 minutes total. Repeat with the remaining latke mixture. Serve with sour cream and applesauce.

HowtoTip.text: Storage: Leftovers can be refrigerated in an airtight container up to 5 days.This recipe was tested in the Instant Vortex Plus 7-in-1 Air Fryer Oven. It will work with any air fryer, but timing may differ slightly.

name: Air Fryer Hanukkah Latkes

author.name: Laura Arnold
author.description: Laura Arnold is a freelance culinary producer, cookbook author and food stylist based in NYC. She most recently was the Culinary Producer for ABC’s “The Chew.” She has written four cookbooks, Instant One-Pot Meals, Dinner Under Pressure, Best Simple Suppers for Two and Best Sweets & Treats for Two, as well as helped several chefs and celebrities write books of their own. Laura can never deny the perfect cheeseburger, fish taco or classic New York black and white cookie.
